events.title: End-of-Semester Pitch Day Highlights
events.description: A resounding success showcasing student innovation and entrepreneurship with industry partners and distinguished judges.
events.fullDescription:
On 11th September, the Faculty of Business Management & Globalisation in collaboration with the Limkokwing Innovation Hub hosted our End-of-Semester Pitch Day—and it was a resounding success!

We extend our heartfelt appreciation to our partners Capitol Foods, Black Gold Creative Studio, and StarrTix, whose support made this event possible. Special thanks to our keynote speaker Emma Fofanah for her inspiring words, and to our distinguished judges Colin Ogoo, Joyce Abigail Coulson-Olowu, Joe Yilla, and Sam Moi, for their invaluable insights.

Together, we are shaping the next generation of innovators and entrepreneurs in Sierra Leone.

events.title: ITC READY Salone Training Sessions
events.description: Transformative training sessions on pitch perfect techniques and AI for digital freelancers in partnership with ITC READY Salone.
events.fullDescription:
Last week, we proudly hosted two transformative sessions in partnership with the ITC READY Salone project:

1. Pitch Perfect Training – Over 50 startup founders, including 10+ women, explored how to craft compelling pitch decks and connect with investors.

2. AI for Digital Freelancers Training – At our monthly freelancer meetup, 60+ participants (including 20+ women) engaged in a practical session on using AI as a productivity partner. Led by Martin Labbé and local co-trainer Abu Theodore Maxwell Rogers.

Special thanks to Korea International Cooperation Agency (KOICA), International Trade Centre (ITC), in collaboration with the Government of Sierra Leone, Ministries of Youth Affairs, Communication, Technology and Innovation, and Trade and Industry.

We remain committed to building capacity, nurturing innovation, and supporting Sierra Leone's entrepreneurial ecosystem.

events.title: Startup Incubation Program – Cohort 3 Orientation
events.description: Welcome orientation for the 3rd Cohort of our Startup Incubation Program with university leadership and new student founders.
events.fullDescription:
Yesterday, the Limkokwing Innovation Hub proudly welcomed the 3rd Cohort of its Startup Incubation Program in an inspiring orientation session.

The session brought together newly selected student founders, faculty leaders, and university management, including the Deputy Campus Director Mr. Aiah James, and Heads of Faculties Mr. John T. Sesay (FBMG), Mr. Oluwatosin (FICT), Mr. Hassan Kamara (FCMB), and Madam Taricia (SSD).

In his remarks, Mr. James encouraged participants to make the most of this opportunity to build sustainable ventures, reaffirming the university's commitment to entrepreneurship and national development.

Mr. Bashir Muhammad Idris, Coordinator of the Innovation Hub, gave a comprehensive presentation on the program's structure, covering the frameworks, methodology and schedule.

A big thank you to everyone who joined us. We're excited to see these young innovators take bold steps toward building impactful startups!
